alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 3:59AM AKST until January 10 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING FOR NUNIVAK ISLAND AND THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. East to southeast winds gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Nunivak Island and the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will warm through the day today with an eventual transition from snow to rain, especially along the Kuskokwim Bay Coast up to Bethel. There is a chance for freezing rain during the transition. Blizzard conditions will persist longest for areas further north, including Mekoryuk, Newtok, and Toksook Bay.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
